text: well then we've had that statement from
the Commerce Department which the tone
of it was generally that mr. Ross hadn't
done anything illegal it did not deny
that mr. Ross did have this financial
stake in the Navigator shipping company
which does a lot of business as you said
with the Russian energy company cyber
but it noted this statement that cyber
itself has never been sanctioned even
though we know it's major shareholders
have been it's it confirmed that mr.
Ross had been on the board of directors
of the shipping company navigator for
two years but it said he had never met
the oligarchs in question nor the
son-in-law of President Putin and it
also said that mr. Ross had recused
himself from any transoceanic shipping
issues that he generally supported
sanctions against Russian entities and
that he was working closely with ethics
officials in the Commerce Department to
uphold ethical standards having said all
that I think there's will still be
questions though about a potential
conflict of interest because of course
mr. Ross has a lot of influence on
issues like sanctions and trade and
really it just doesn't look very good in
the current climate in Washington which
has completely caught up with this
investigation into potential links
between the Trump administration and the
Russians and this looks to be one of the
first reported business links even
though an indirect one between a member
of the Trump administration and members
of mr. Putin's inner circle all right
Barbara thank you very much indeed
